Focus.description: Unable to sustain attention; constantly distracted and needs continuous redirection.
Can focus for 5-10 minutes with close support and frequent prompts.
Maintains focus for 15-20 minutes with occasional reminders.
Stays engaged for 30-45 minutes with minimal support; takes breaks as needed.
Sustained attention for 45-60 minutes; self-regulates breaks independently.
Excellent focus for extended periods; rarely distracted and fully self-directed.

Social Interaction.description: Avoids social contact; shows strong withdrawal and minimal interest in peers.
Engages in basic greetings but struggles to maintain conversations; needs support for group activities.
Can hold two-way conversations with some support; participates in structured group play.
Comfortable in small groups; initiates conversations and shares ideas with peers.
Enjoys social interactions; initiates games and resolves minor conflicts well.
Highly sociable; thrives in group settings and naturally mentors peers.

Sensory Sensitivity.description: Severe sensory overload; cannot tolerate bright lights, loud sounds, or certain textures.
Strong sensitivity to specific stimuli; needs regular sensory breaks and accommodations.
Tolerates most environments with minor adjustments; occasional sensory breaks help.
Comfortable in typical settings; manages everyday sensory input with minimal support.
Rarely affected by sensory input; highly resilient in varied environments.
No noticeable sensitivity; handles intense stimuli without distress.

Motor Skills.description: Significant motor challenges; struggles with basic fine and gross motor tasks.
Limited coordination; can perform simple tasks but needs help with complex movements.
Completes routine tasks like buttoning with guidance; occasional clumsiness.
Performs most tasks independently; smooth movements in familiar settings.
Good coordination for daily activities; rarely stumbles or drops things.
Excellent motor proficiency in both fine and gross motor skills.

Routine Preference.description: Cannot tolerate any change; experiences extreme distress with new or altered routines.
Very rigid; requires extensive preparation and reassurance for any routine changes.
Prefers predictable structure; accepts changes after clear explanation and support.
Adapts to routine changes with some guidance; manages transitions independently.
Comfortable when plans change; adjusts to new situations with minimal anxiety.
Highly flexible; embraces variety and seamlessly adapts to major changes.

Emotional Regulation.description: Frequent intense outbursts; unable to calm down without significant external support.
Strong emotions occur regularly; needs calming strategies and co-regulation support.
Manages feelings with brief support; uses simple techniques like deep breathing.
Maintains composure most of the time; self-regulates in routine situations.
Handles stress and frustration independently; calm under moderate pressure.
Exceptional emotional control; resilient and self-sufficient in challenging scenarios.
